intro: Stelis ebenea, commonly known as the orchid orchid, is a species of orchid belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, often arranged in racemes. Stelis ebenea thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
